plugins.name: strings_repository
plugins.description:
Simple plugin to synchronise translations with strings repository. Allows to push and pull translations from your own server. Works with active selection to speedup parsing processes.


Usage:

Enter connection details and press connect button.

After selection of element press "refresh selection" to get text labels from selection.

Press "pull" to fetch translations from remote server.

Press "apply" to apply translations from selected translations to document selection.

Press "push" to send translations to remote server.
plugins.tagline: Synchronize your translations

plugins.name: Orange Tokens: Primitive Variables Generator
plugins.description:
Description

Orange Tokens helps you turn any base color into a full set of tints and shades — instantly and intelligently. Whether you’re starting a new design system or refining an existing one, this plugin makes it easy to generate consistent, customizable color variables in Figma.


No more manual tweaks or guesswork — Orange Tokens helps you scale your colors the smart way.


🚀 How to use

  1. Enter your base colors and give them names
  2. Press “Generate Variables”
  3. Orange Tokens generates variables with tints, shades, and smart naming
  4. Use the generated palette directly as design tokens, or tweak and reuse them across your system.


✨ Features

  1. One-click color palette generation
  2. Auto-generated tints & shades from base colors
  3. Design token–friendly naming system
  4. Organized Figma variables by base name
  5. Great for light/dark mode, theming, and token systems
  6. Fast, clean, and easy to use — even at scale


⚙️ How it works

Orange Tokens applies a structured algorithm to your base hex values, producing harmonious tints and shades. Each palette is mapped to a name you provide (like green, orange, blue) and creates a set of Figma variables grouped logically — perfect for scaling your system with consistency.


Everything happens in a few clicks, without breaking your existing styles or variables.


💬 Feedback and feature ideas?

This is just the beginning — future updates will explore typography tokens, spacing, mode support, and more. Have an idea or request? Email me at inamdar.chinmay25@gmail.com, or leave a comment on the plugin page!
plugins.tagline: Generate color palette & token generator for your design system

136496.release_notes:
✨ What’s New

Color Picker + Eyedropper Integration
You can now click on the color preview to open a color input — allowing you to manually select a color or use the eyedropper tool directly in Figma. No need to type in hex codes anymore!

Smart Base Adjustment
When adding a new color, the plugin automatically adjusts the base step to prevent duplicate light/dark values across your palette — helping you maintain clean, conflict-free primitives.

plugins.name: Condens
plugins.description:
With the Condens plugin, you can quickly import highlights from Condens into FigJam. This keeps your insights intact, preserving key details like participant names and links back to the original data.


Perfect for brainstorming, organizing ideas, and running synthesis workshops with your team — without losing the context behind your research, even when switching between tools.


How it works:

  1. Export your highlights from Condens as a CSV file.
  2. Open the Condens plugin in FigJam and upload the CSV file.
  3. Your Highlights are instantly converted into sticky notes, complete with the respondent’s name and a direct link back to the original data in Condens, ready to use in your FigJam board.


Contact us for support, book a demo to get a personalized walkthrough, or visit our Help Center for more information.

If you're not using Condens yet, start your free 15-day trial at condens.io.
plugins.tagline: Import Highlights from Condens into Figjam

plugins.name: Silent Sweep
plugins.description:
Silent Sweep is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly managing concealed elements in your designs. This powerful tool scans your current page, revealing all hidden layers within each frame and artboard.

With its intuitive card-based interface, you can quickly identify and select hidden elements, streamlining your cleanup process.


Key Features:


  1. Instant Detection: Automatically finds all hidden layers on your current page.
  2. Organized View: Displays hidden layers grouped by their parent frames for easy navigation.
  3. Selective Cleanup: Choose which hidden layers to remove with simple checkboxes.
  4. Real-time Updates: Refreshes automatically when you switch pages or make changes.
  5. Efficient Workflow: Helps maintain clean, organized Figma files without tedious manual searching.


Whether you're polishing up a final design or inheriting a complex file, Silent Sweep helps you maintain a tidy workspace. Say goodbye to forgotten hidden layers and hello to cleaner, more manageable Figma projects. Simplify your design process and boost your productivity with Silent Sweep – your personal cleanup assistant in Figma
plugins.tagline: Unveil and Tidy: Your Hidden Layer Ally

plugins.name: Smart Rename
plugins.description:
Smart Rename is a powerful Figma plugin built to streamline your workflow by letting you bulk rename frames customizable base names and smart suffixes like version numbers, dimensions, or sequence numbers.


It also fixes a common frustration in UI design: decimal positioning. When frames have non-integer X or Y values, exported assets often end up with unwanted white lines or blurry edges. Smart Rename solves this by auto-aligning frames to the nearest whole pixel, ensuring clean, sharp exports every time.


From organization to export-readiness, this plugin saves time and eliminates manual, error-prone tasks—all in a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Bulk rename and align Figma frames in seconds. Add version, size, or number suffixes effortlessly.

plugins.name: Usably
plugins.description:
Usably: Instant UX Feedback Powered by AI


Get actionable insights to improve usability, accessibility, and visual consistency—all without needing an API key!


This plugin analyzes your design against core UX principles like Hick's Law, Jakob's Law, and more.


How It Works:

  1. Select an area: Choose a single frame or an entire flow with multiple frames.
  2. Click "Review Design": Start the analysis with just one click.
  3. Get feedback: Usably generates comprehensive, actionable feedback to refine your design.


Key Features:

✅ Easy setup: NO API key needed - Install the plugin, sign up with your email, and start reviewing in seconds.

✅ Advanced UX analysis: Incorporates proven UX laws for better design decisions.


The subscription and payment of the plugin is managed by Figma marketplace. You can follow their help center to unsubscribe.


🦄 Free plan includes 5 reviews, paid subscription includes 100 reviews per month.


💌 Need help? Reach out to the Usably team at usably.team@gmail.com.
plugins.tagline: AI-powered UX reviews with insights—no API key needed. Install and start improving your designs!

MAPPE makes navigation in big files easier. The plugin shows where are you exactly on the canvas.

plugins.name: Collect and Rename
plugins.description:
Collect and Rename allows users to easily collect text elements from a design document, rename them, and navigate to specific layers on different pages.


Main features:


1. Collection of text elements:

- The plugin automatically collects all text elements in the document.

2. Renaming texts:

- Ability to rename text layers directly in the plugin interface.

- After renaming, text layers are updated in real time.

3. Layer navigation:

- Ability to navigate to a specific layer, even if it is on a different page of the document.



How to use the plugin:


1. Installation and launch:

- Install the "Collect and Rename" plugin from the Figma Community.

- Open your project in Figma and launch the plugin through the "Plugins" menu.

2. Text collection:

- The plugin will automatically collect all text elements from the current document and display them in the interface.

3. Renaming texts:

- In the plugin interface, you will see a list of all text layers.

- For each text element:

- "Current text" shows the current text of the layer.

- "New text" provides a field for entering new text.

- Enter the new text in the "New text" field and press "Apply" or the Enter key to confirm.

- The layer text will be updated, and you will see a notification about a successful update.

4. Navigation to layers:

- Click on the text field of the layer to automatically navigate to it in the document, even if it is on a different page.

5. Closing the plugin:

- Close the plugin when you finish your work by pressing the "Close" button in the plugin interface.
plugins.tagline: The plugin shows all text layers in a list, making it easy to replace text.

Auto Palette is a plugin that helps designers extract smart, context-aware color palettes directly from images using precise formulas — including average, dominant, and contrast-aware color models.


In a time when Material 3 is embracing expressive tones and iOS 19 leaks tease a UI shift toward progressive blur and dynamic visuals, Auto Palette gives you a reliable starting point to build your own adaptive, fluid color systems.

plugins.name: Countastic
plugins.description:
Countastic is the ultimate Figma calculator plugin, built to help product designers create data-centric products and screens faster and more efficiently.


Add, subtract, calculate averages and percentages automatically and use them in your designs with a single click, making the data on screen believable and relevant to your customers, stakeholders and usability test participants.


A must have for any designer sweating the details of data tables, sales and analytics dashboards, finance or e-commerce products.


Get the license

(7 day trial, team discounts available)


Get started

Countastic performs calculations on objects selected in your Figma file, showing you results you can copy or place on the canvas with a single click.


Open Countastic and:

  1. Select two or more text objects in your Figma file
  2. See the sum, difference, average and percentage difference of the selected objects.
  3. Click the result of a calculation to copy to clipboard
  4. Click the “Place” button beside the calculation to add the result to the canvas


Countastic works with:

  1. Currencies (including US, UK and European separator and decimal point styles)
  2. Units of measure
  3. Any numerical values containing prefixes or suffixes


Countastic helps you calculate:

  1. Sums
  2. Differences
  3. Averages
  4. Percentage differences (between 2 objects only)


Get the license

(7 day trial, team discounts available)


Questions and feedback

Countastic requires no setup, allowing you to hit the ground running and use relevant, real-looking data in your designs.


If you have feedback about Countastic or want to share an idea or a feature request, drop me a line on X, Bluesky or Threads.
plugins.tagline: A fully-automated calculator inside Figma

plugins.name: Link Manager
plugins.description:
Figma でのリンク管理に悩んでいませんか？


デザイン内のリンクが散らばっていて、手作業で整理するのが大変…。

Link Manager を使えば、リンクの検出・削除が数クリックで完了！

リンクの整理をもっと簡単に。スッキリとしたデザイン管理 を実現しましょう！🚀


Managing links in Figma can be frustrating—especially when working on large projects with scattered hyperlinks.


With Link Manager, you can effortlessly find, copy, and remove links from your Figma files in just a few clicks.


No more clutter, no more manual cleanups. Keep your designs neat, organized, and efficient with this powerful yet easy-to-use plugin! 🚀


🔹 主な機能 | Key Features


✅ 🔍 自動リンク検出 | Auto-Detect Hyperlinks – 選択したフレーム内の すべてのリンクを瞬時にリストアップ

✅ 🗑 簡単なリンク削除 | Easy Link Removal – 選択したリンクを削除 or すべてのリンクを一括削除

✅ 🌍 多言語対応 | Multi-language Support – 英語 & 日本語 に対応



🔹 使い方 | How to Use


🇯🇵 日本語

1️⃣ 「Detect Links」 をクリック → デザイン内のリンクをリストアップ

2️⃣ 「Remove Selected」 で 選択したリンクを削除

3️⃣ 「Remove All」 ですべてのリンクを一括削除


💡 Figma 内のリンク管理をスマートに！


🇬🇧 English

1️⃣ Click “Detect Links” to scan your Figma file for all hyperlinks

2️⃣ Select specific links and click “Remove Selected” to delete them

3️⃣ Click “Remove All” to erase every hyperlink from your design


💡 Easily manage hyperlinks in Figma with just a few clicks!



🎯 こんな方におすすめ | Who is This Plugin For?


🇯🇵 日本語

🔹 デザイナー - Figma ファイルを整理したい

🔹 チーム - Figma でリンクを共有・管理するプロジェクトに最適

🔹 開発者 - デザインからすべてのリンクを抽出したい

🔹 プロジェクトマネージャー - レビュー時にリンクを整理したい

🔹 リンクを手軽に管理したいすべてのユーザー！


🇺🇸 English

🔹 UI/UX Designers - Keep your Figma files structured

🔹 Teams - Perfect for projects with shared links

🔹 Developers - Extract all links from a design efficiently

🔹 Project Managers - Easily organize links during reviews

🔹 Anyone who wants hassle-free hyperlink management!
plugins.tagline: Easily manage hyperlinks in Figma with just a few clicks!

plugins.name: Lock All Ratios
plugins.description:
### Features


Base on the new official figma feature Aspect Ratio Locked


- 🖼️ **Batch Operations**: Lock/unlock aspect ratios of multiple images with one click

- 🔍 **Smart Filtering**:

- Filter by ratio: Quickly find images with the same aspect ratio

- Filter by lock state: Easily distinguish between locked and unlocked images

- 👀 **Preview Features**:

- Thumbnail previews

- Display image dimensions and ratios

- Click to locate images on canvas

- 🌐 **Bilingual**: Supports both English and Chinese interfaces


### Use Cases

- When maintaining consistent image ratios

- Processing large numbers of image resources

- Organizing and checking image ratios

- Quickly locating images with specific ratios


### How to Use

1. Select images to process

2. Use top filters to filter images as needed

3. Operate individually or in batch

4. Click image thumbnails or names to locate them on canvas


### Quick Operations

- Select/Deselect All: Use the checkbox in the table header

- Quick Filter: Use the ratio and lock state filters at the top

- Batch Operations: Use "Lock All"/"Unlock All" buttons in the bottom toolbar

- Refresh List: Use the refresh button in the bottom toolbar


---


基于 figma 新发布的 “图片比例锁定” 功能开发


### 功能特点

- 🖼️ **批量操作**：一键锁定/解锁多个图片的宽高比

- 🔍 **智能筛选**：

- 按比例筛选：快速找到相同比例的图片

- 按锁定状态筛选：轻松区分已锁定和未锁定的图片

- 👀 **预览功能**：

- 缩略图预览

- 显示图片尺寸和比例

- 点击可快速定位到画布中的图片

- 🌐 **双语支持**：支持中文和英文界面


### 使用场景

- 需要保持多个图片比例一致时

- 批量处理大量图片资源时

- 整理和检查图片比例时

- 快速定位特定比例的图片


### 使用方法

1. 选择要处理的图片

2. 使用顶部筛选器按需过滤图片

3. 可以单个操作，也可以批量选择后操作

4. 点击图片缩略图或名称可快速定位到画布中的图片


### 快捷操作

- 全选/取消全选：使用表格顶部的复选框

- 快速筛选：使用顶部的比例和锁定状态筛选器

- 批量操作：使用底部工具栏的 " 锁定全部 "/" 解锁全部 " 按钮

- 刷新列表：使用底部工具栏的刷新按钮

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.name: Text to Frame Name
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin “Text to Frame Name” is a handy tool that allows you to replace selected text with the name of the highest-level frame it belongs to, all at once. This is particularly useful for page numbers in presentation materials or proposals. For example, you can set frame names with sequential numbers like “01,” “02,” and “03,” place temporary text (e.g., “00”) on each page, select all the text, and run this plugin to complete page numbering. Even if you reorder or add pages, you can easily reset the numbers by simply modifying the frame names. This eliminates the need for manual number adjustments, significantly improving workflow efficiency.


Figmaプラグイン「Text to Frame Name」は、選択したテキストを、それぞれが属する最上位のフレーム名に一括で置き換えることができる便利なツールです。主にプレゼンテーション資料や提案書などのページ番号で役立ちます。たとえば「01」「02」「03」など連番がついたフレーム名にしておき、各ページに仮のテキスト（例：00）を配置し、すべてのテキストを選択してこのプラグインを実行するだけで、ページ番号制作が完了します。ページを入れ替えたり追加したりしても、フレーム名さえ修正すれば簡単に番号を再設定可能。手動で番号を修正する必要がなくなり、作業効率が大きく向上します。
plugins.tagline: Auto-convert text layers to parent frame names

plugins.name: Rename From Sublayer
plugins.description:
Rename from sublayers simplifies the process of renaming groups in Figma by automatically detecting image, text or shape layers within selected groups.


You can choose between five modes: image detection, text layer, Rectangle layer, ellipse layer and symbols detection.

Additionally, you can opt to rename all child groups within the hierarchy or just the top-level group, giving you full control over your naming conventions.


Key Features:

  1. Image, Text, Shape Detection: Automatically rename groups based on image names, text names, rectangle names, ellipse names and symbols.
  2. Selective Renaming: Choose to rename just the highest-level group or all nested child groups.
  3. User-Friendly Interface: Simple and intuitive UI to quickly toggle between options.


Whether you're managing large design systems or working on a small project, Rename from sublayers helps keep your layers organized and your workflow efficient.

plugins.name: Fancy Figma to Bricks builder
plugins.description:
Forget doing things twice — design smarter by managing your variables, color palette and designs in Figma, then effortlessly transfer everything into Bricks builder with just a few clicks.


Plugin video: https://youtu.be/5_52ZX3yfGQ


Website: https://fancyframework.com/figma-plugin/


Purchase an early adopter license for 10 instances*: BUY NOW

Documentation: https://fancyframework.com/docs/

Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/fancybricks

YouTube: https://youtube.com/@fancybricks


* An instance refers to each individual installation of the software, whether on different devices or platforms. For example, if you activate the license on the desktop app and also use it on the web version, even with the same user account, it will count as two separate instances.


How it works?


Fancy Framework for Figma streamlines your workflow in three simple steps — from defining your design system in Figma to building real pages in Bricks. Here’s how:


Set up your design variables in Figma

Define your entire design system directly in Figma — colors, typography, spacing, and more. Group and name your variables for better clarity and consistency across your designs.


Export your variables and color palette to Bricks

With just a few clicks, convert your Figma variables into Bricks-compatible values. Keep your color system consistent across design and development — no need to manually recreate anything.


Copy from Figma, paste into Bricks

Select any Auto Layout section in Figma, copy it, and paste it directly into the Bricks editor. Supports autolayout, semantic tags, classes, grids and native Bricks elements — just like you designed it.


Main features

Fancy Figma to bricks builder plugin gives you everything you need to streamline your workflow: organize design variables, export color palettes, and paste fully structured sections directly into Bricks. No more duplicated effort — just clean, scalable, and efficient web design.


Advanced variable support

Use calc, rem, number and clamp() directly in your Figma variables for greater flexibility and control.


Auto-generate color variations

Generate transparent, darkened, and lightened versions of your colors instantly — no need to create them manually. Perfect for building accessible and consistent UI systems.


Export dynamic variables to Bricks

Thanks to support for clamp, calc, rem, and numeric operations, your Figma variables are ready for real-world usage inside Bricks — no tweaks needed.


Bricks-ready color palette export

Automatically export your color palette from Figma, linked directly to your variables — ready to import into Bricks and use seamlessly across your entire site.


Seamless copy-paste from Figma to Bricks

Copy any section built with Auto Layout in Figma and paste it directly into Bricks — layout structure, classes, and semantic tags all preserved.


Copy-Paste Features


Built for Auto Layout

By following best practices, your sections will copy perfectly into Bricks — layout, spacing, and hierarchy intact. Check out my free figma course: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbc4J3wWyVcdnL9A_UA-WdE2tXRUW-I8O


Semantic HTML tag support

Your Figma sections can include semantic tags like [section], [container], [ul], [li], [h1–h6], [p], [span], and more. Perfect for SEO, accessibility, and clean markup.


Support for display grid

Display grid support uses (grid-x) (grid-x-x) to apply display: grid in Bricks automatically when pasting.


Class-friendly workflow

Use meaningful class names in Figma and watch them transfer seamlessly into Bricks. Combine with utility classes for maximum flexibility and control.


Bricks-native element compatibility

Paste sections that automatically map to Bricks' native elements like:

  1. Buttons
  2. Links
  3. SVG
  4. Forms
  5. Tabs
  6. Accordions
  7. Nav menu
  8. Logo
  9. Counters
  10. More will be added
plugins.tagline: The ultimate web design workflow for Bricks Builder

plugins.name: IconBridge – Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that automates icon exports, optimizes assets, and pushes them directly to GitHub—seamlessly integrating design and development. IconBridge eliminates manual file handling, ensuring every icon is correctly formatted, optimized, and instantly available for development.



✨ Key Features


  1. Optimized Icon Export – Export icons directly from Figma with automatic light/dark version generation for multi-colored icons.
  2. Seamless GitHub Integration – Push icons directly from Figma to GitHub, with automated organization and validation.
  3. Automated Pull Request Creation – IconBridge commits and opens a GitHub PR automatically, streamlining the handoff process.
  4. Secure Repository Access – Uses GitHub authentication to ensure private and controlled icon handoff.




🚀 How to Use


Quick & Optimized Icon Export

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click “Export Icons” on the home screen.
  3. IconBridge automatically optimizes each icon, ensuring clean, lightweight SVGs.
  4. Click “Save” to download optimized icons directly to your device.


Automated Handoff to GitHub

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click “Export to GitHub” to begin the automation.
  3. IconBridge optimizes and validates each icon before uploading.
  4. Automatically organizes icons in the correct repository folder.
  5. Creates a pull request automatically, ready for developer review.




🛠️ What You’ll Need

  1. A Figma project with icons.
  2. A GitHub repository for automated exports.




🔒 Secure & Seamless Workflow

IconBridge ensures a secure, efficient, and automated handoff process:


  1. Direct Figma-to-GitHub integration—no external storage needed.
  2. Authentication with GitHub to keep your repository secure.
  3. Fully automated workflow—eliminating manual exports, uploads, and PR creation.


🚀 Forget tedious icon management—let IconBridge automate everything from Figma to production!
plugins.tagline: Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: MagicText
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow by recognizing, transforming, and cleaning up text layers in seconds. Whether you're extracting text from images, converting case styles, or refining typography, this tool enhances productivity and ensures design consistency with just a few clicks.


How It Works:


1. Text Recognition

Use the built-in text recognize to quickly extract text from image layers. Simply select an image layer, choose the desired language, and launch text recognition – the plugin will automatically create a new text layer with the extracted content.

Supported Languages: MagicText supports a wide range of languages: English, Chinese, Ukrainian, Spanish, German, French, Japanese, Korean, Arabic, Portuguese, Italian, Bulgarian, Greek, Hebrew, Hindi, Turkish and more.


2. Text Transformation:

Easily change the case of your text with a single click:

  1. Title Case: Capitalize the first letter of each word.
  2. Sentence Case: Capitalize only the first letter of each sentence.
  3. UPPERCASE & lowercase: Convert your text to all uppercase or all lowercase letters.


3. Text Manipulation:

Seamlessly merge multiple text layers into one or split a single text layer into individual sentences for easier editing.


4. Style Cleanup:

  1. Remove Hyperlinks: Automatically strip out hyperlinks from your text.
  2. Remove All Styles: Reset text and color styles, reverting your text to a clean, default appearance.


5. Character Counter:

Instantly see the number of characters, sentences, and words in your selected text layers for precise text management.


Key Features:

  1. Image-Based Text Recognition: Extract text from images with support for multiple languages.
  2. Case Conversion Options: Transform text to sentence case, title case, UPPERCASE, or lowercase in just a few clicks.
  3. Text Layer Manipulation: Merge and split text layers effortlessly to suit your workflow.
  4. Style Reset: Remove hyperlinks and reset text formatting to maintain consistency in your designs.
  5. Real-Time Character Counting: Keep track of characters, sentences, and words in real time.


Who Is It For?

MagicText is designed for Figma designers who want to streamline their text formatting and editing process. By automating repetitive tasks and offering powerful text transformation tools, MagicText allows you to focus more on creative design and less on manual text adjustments.


Feedback & Future Updates

Welcome your professional insights and suggestions for improvements. Your feedback is invaluable and will be carefully reviewed to guide future updates. Please share your ideas and help us enhance MagicText. Leave your feedback here.
plugins.tagline: Recognize, transform, and clean text layers instantly—enhancing productivity and consistency.

plugins.name: The Settler — localiser for external (or missing) alias variables
plugins.description:
(Русский внизу 👇)

en:

This plugin localises all alias variables that refer to missing base variables (those located in external files or simply deleted)

🎦 Video demonstration: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk


Why is this a problem?! Figma doesn't care about these links, it doesn't transfer them to the new file, but leaves the links to the companion variables (base/master variables) in the old file. And this isn't what you expect when you copy variables :)


In simple words, what the plugin does:

  1. It looks for alias variables that have a reference to base variables that didn't make it to this file (either left in another file or simply missing)
  2. Creates copies of such variables in this file
  3. Rebinds the alias variable, changing the reference from the external master variable (base variable) to the newly created local one


Works for variables of all types:

  1. color,
  2. text,
  3. boolean,
  4. numeric

It should work with multiple mods, but I haven't tested this part.


ru:

Плагин поможет, когда вы взяли и "тупа" скопировали переменные из другого файла, а там были алиасы (переменные ссылались на другие переменные).

🎦 Видео-демонстрация: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk

Но вот незадача! Figma не заботиться об этих связях, она не переносит их в новый файл, а оставляет ссылки на переменные-спутники (базовые/мастер-переменные) в старом файле. А это вообще не то, чего ждёшь, когда копируешь переменные :)


Простыми словами, что делает плагин:

  1. Ищет переменные-алиасы, которые ссылаются на базовые переменные, не дошедшие до этого файла (либо оставшиеся в другом файле, либо пропавшие без вести)
  2. Создает копии таких переменных в этом файле
  3. Перевязывает алиас-переменную, меняя ссылку с внешней мастер-переменной (базовой переменной) на локальную


Работает для переменных всех типов:

  1. цветовые,
  2. текстовые,
  3. булевы,
  4. числовые


По идее, должно работает и с множественными модами, но я не тестил этот момент

accepted.name: Studio The
accepted.description:
The UX/UI designer,
The Motion designer

plugins.name: Inflo-UX
plugins.description:
Introducing InFlo-UX – the prototype plugin for Figma (Adobe XD and Sketch to follow) that transforms your document content index into an interactive prototype.

InFlo-UX seamlessly ingests content index documents of all kinds, automatically creating numbered and labeled frames, all while retaining the project name, section titles, and page numbers.


Ideal for agencies and designers looking to streamline workflows,

InFlo-UX accelerates your design process by turning static content into an interactive, organized prototype with just a few clicks!
plugins.tagline: From Index to UX
